featured.text: The task of bringing the ship into the harbor and anchoring it is taken up by a different captain.
People sometimes crash into reefs with their boats or drop anchors on them, breaking off large chunks of coral.
Also, the wind can significantly alter the direction of the ship and how it reacts, adding to the difficulty of anchoring the ship.

definition.zh_def: 錨：用於固定船隻或其他物體的重物，通常由金屬製成，能夠在水底抓住地面。
definition.en_def: A heavy object used to moor a vessel to the sea bottom, typically made of metal and designed to grip the seabed.
definition.example: The sailor dropped the anchor to keep the boat from drifting away.
